com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.rest

Class RestServiceAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.services.process.BaseActivity
      • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.activity.DefaultActivityImpl
        • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.TextAdapterActivity
          • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.http.HttpServiceAdapter
            • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.rest.RestServiceAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdapterActivity, GeneralActivity, AdapterInvocationError, HeaderAwareAdapter, TextAdapter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiRestServiceAdapter

    @Tracked(value=TRACE)
public class RestServiceAdapter
extends HttpServiceAdapter
implements HeaderAwareAdapter

                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                        throws ConnectionException,
                               AdapterException
        Invokes the RESTful service by submitting an HTTP request against the configured endpoint URI. Override getRequestData() to provide the requestData value (usually a String).
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface TextAdapter
        Overrides:
        invoke in class HttpServiceAdapter
        timeout - time out in seconds. Ignored if no response is expected.
        headers - protocol request data, e.g. correlation ID
        Returns:
        response if the underlying protocol is synchronous or null otherwise
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable exception
        AdapterException - non-retriable exception
        See Also:
        TextAdapter.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String, int, java.util.Map)

      • getRequestData

        protected java.lang.String getRequestData()
                                   throws ActivityException
        The method overrides the one from the super class and does the following:
        • For HTTP GET and DELETE requests, it returns an empty string
        • Otherwise it gets the value of the variable with the name specified in the attribute REQUEST_VARIABLE. The value is typically an XML document or a string
        • It invokes the variable translator to convert the value into a string and then returns the string value.
        For HTTP methods other than GET and DELETE this will throw an exception if the request data variable is not bound, or the value is not a DocumentReference or String.
        Overrides:
        getRequestData in class TextAdapterActivity
        Throws:
        ActivityException
